result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen W Dejewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count #1:
-  90 days jail without Huber commencing 3/14/2016 by 5pm consecutive to any other sentence in being.  The defendant has 1 day credit for time served. 
-  $543 costs/dom. abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. 


The Court orders that the financial obligations in Count #1, #3 and Atty. fees at the rate of $75 per month starting 9/30/16.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 21 day jail consecutive for the costs and surcharges and 20 day jail consecutive for the attorney fees.

-  90 days jail without Huber commencing 3/14/2016 by 5pm consecutive to any other sentence in being.  The defendant has 1 day credit for time served. 

Consecutive to: any other sentence in being

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen W Dejewski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:50am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Defendant Stephen W Dejewski in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
Court reviews the terms and conditions of the agreement reached by the parties. 
COUNT #1 and COUNT #3 - State moves to strike the "repeater" enhancer, thereby making the charges misd.; so ordered by the Court. 
COUNT #1 and COUNT #3 WITHOUT THE REPEATER - Guilty  plea entered by the Def.   Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea and Finds the Def. guilty and Orders that Judgment of Conviction be entered.
State moves to read-in and dismiss Count #2; so ordered by the Court. 
Victim Impact Statment submitted by the State.
Recommendations presented by Counsel.
Statement presented by the defendant. 

The Court orders:
Count #1:
-  90 days jail without Huber commencing 3/14/2016 by 5pm consecutive to any other sentence in being.  The defendant has 1 day credit for time served. 
-  $543 costs/dom. abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. 

Count #3:
-  90 days jail without Huber consecutive to the sentence ordered in Count #1. 
-  $543 costs/dom. abuse surcharge and DNA surcharge. 

The Court orders that the financial obligations in Count #1, #3 and Atty. fees at the rate of $75 per month starting 9/30/16.  Failure to pay as ordered will result in 21 day jail consecutive for the costs and surcharges and 20 day jail consecutive for the attorney fees.

Case called at 1:32 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Stephen W Dejewski in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Luchsinger: Tendered offer about an hour ago, would like some time to review. Will be gone some time in February, request to put over to March 4th or 5th
Court reminds Mr. Dejewski that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 1:33 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 3/8/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 8:41 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Stephen W Dejewski in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Luchsinger: Case is not yet settled, requests additional STC in approximately 2 weeks
ADA Teuber: No Objection
Court continues bond 
Recess: 8:43 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 2/5/16 at 1:15 pm - Send notices
Time to Pay / Payment Extension Reminder

Court appoints Attorney Luchsinger (alt. Atty Fischer)

Court orders reimbursement of $35 per month with the first payment due on 2/29/16
Change of Phone number provided by the Defendant

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:17pm. [mo]
[Commissioner Weber presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Stephen W Dejewski appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (For Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that SPD will represent Mr. Dejewski for bond purposes only
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to Counsel given
The State does not waive Preliminary time limits.

Bond Arguments given by Counsel
The Court requires a $10,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--no discussion of the case with Robin Kast
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
Comm. Weber notifies Mr. Dejewski of how to obtain a court appointed attorney, if he wishes

recess 1:35 pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/20/16 at 11:20am   (2) Status Conference on 1/22/16 at 8:30am
